message.content:
cs.LG, cs.AI, cs.RO, cs.CV, cs.SY

This paper is likely to belong to the arXiv CS sub-category of cs.LG (Machine Learning) as it proposes a method for meta-learning using demonstrations and trial-and-error experience with sparse reward feedback. Additionally, the paper also discusses the limitations of traditional imitation learning and reinforcement learning approaches, which are both sub-fields of machine learning. 

The paper also involves vision-based control tasks, which suggests that it may also belong to the sub-category of cs.CV (Computer Vision). 

Furthermore, the paper deals with control tasks, which suggests that it may also belong to the sub-category of cs.RO (Robotics). 

The paper also involves learning policies for tasks, which suggests that it may also belong to the sub-category of cs.AI (Artificial Intelligence). 

Finally, the paper involves learning from demonstrations, which suggests that it may also belong to the sub-category of cs.SY (Systems and Control).
